She lacks working capital, since in July there is more demand from customers, who place orders for the suits they will wear in the festivities that will take place during this month. What she needs most are fabrics in various colors and textures, as well as thread of various colors. They also make very colorful tablecloths (like the one in the photo). She is sure to have success in the business, since she knows the customers very well.

She belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and in all these years she has learned to work and fight for her goals. In her association, she learned to be responsible and make her loan repayments, which they bring to each monthly meeting. Marilu will use the money to buy fabric, thread, and other materials in order to continue with the family business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other sewing items

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Umarr is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umarr was born in Koidu Gbasseh in Eastern Sierra Leone, about 41 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have two children attending primary school. For 15 years now, Umarr has been selling used clothes, etc. This is the first loan that Umarr and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Umarr will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand his business, he will buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock. 

Also included on the photo (second from right) is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Dossou Gérard

texts.fr: Dossou Gérard est âgé de 26 ans et est marié à une certaine Mariette. Dossou Gérard a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Dossou Gérard a un autre enfant à sa charge. Dossou Gérard et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Dossou Gérard a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire puis a appris la coiffure, activité qu'il exerce depuis une douzaine d'année. Parallèlement à cette activité, Dossou Gérard vend des appareils électro-ménagers. Dans le but de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l'acquisition de matériels de coiffure et de produits cosmétiques, Dossou Gérard  sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Dossou Gérard de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Dossou Gérard a bien remboursé ses trois premiers crédits.
texts.en:
Dossou Gérard is 26 years old and married to a woman named Mariette. He has three children, of whom some are in school. In addition to his children, he has another child to support. Dossou Gérard and his wife lives together with their children. The diverse family expenses are covered by the couple. 

Dossou Gérard left primary school and then learned how to style hair, work he has been doing for a dozen years. On the side, he sells household appliances. 

With the goal of equipping his hair salon better through the purchase of hair supplies and equipment and cosmetics, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fourth time. This loan will surely enable Dossou Gérard to do better in meeting customer demands. 

Dossou Gérard has indeed paid back his first three loans.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
La señora Venancia  de 48 años de edad, es una persona que vive solo con su conyugue en su casa de habitación ubicada en la aldea el Tular, Nacaome al sur de Honduras, no tubo hijos y se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de pulpería, Ella tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por su atención y buen trato a sus clientes.
Doña Venancia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como  agua, frescos, lácteos, carnes, jabón y  detergentes.
Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y seguir creciendo ya que es uno de sus retos para los próximos años.
Doña Venancia su sueño es que su pulpería sea la más grande de la zona.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Venancia, age 48, lives with her husband in the village of El Tular in Nacaome, which is in southern Honduras.  She does not have children.

She has had her grocery store for three years.  She has a lot of clientele who prefer her for the service and good treatment she give her customers.

Venancia is requesting the loan to buy products like water, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, soap, and detergents.  With the support of this loan she intends to continue investing in her business and to continue growing.  This is one of her challenges for the coming years.

Venancia’s dream is for her grocery store to be the largest in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June, 2012

loans.use: to buy water, soft drinks, dairy products, meat, soap, and detergents for her business

loans.name: Fante

texts.en: Fante extracts palm oil, which she sells at Yabiw near Takoradi. She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. She currently uses her income to support her husband in paying their housing bills. Fante will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit for her work. With the new profit, she plans to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for her work.

loans.name: Minonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINONKPO est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Simon. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage, Julienne vend de la provende à son domicile. Julienne s’approvisionne dans une boutique au Bénin. Julienne exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans, activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Julienne désire obtenir un premier financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe MINONKPO auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MINONKPO comprises three persons who are friends belonging to the same tontine. The group's representative, Julienne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. This is the first time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting its business. 

Julienne is 47 years old and married to a carpenter by the name of Simon. The couple have six children, all in school and in their care. Julienne lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To help cover the diverse needs of the home, Julienne sells provisions out of her home. She gets her supplies from a store in Benin. She has been in this business for four years, and it enables her to  support herself. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and responding better to customer demands, Julienne along with the rest of her group MINONKPO would like to obtain new financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía tiene 48 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 20 años, en la localidad de Chalampampa, junto a tres de sus siete hijos.  
Cuando era niña ayudaba a sus padres en la agricultura, cuidando los sembríos, regando y fertilizando y muchas veces se quedaba horas sacando los frutos de la tierra. Esa responsabilidad aumentó cuando sus padres le heredaron sus terrenos agrícolas donde tenía que sembrar por ella misma, ver la cantidad de semilla, distribuir el dinero y buscar compradores; no era sencillo. Pero ahora, con la experiencia que tiene, puede comercializar sus cultivos de maíz, papa y cebada a buen precio, además de ser una persona muy trabajadora. “Me gusta cuidar el crecimiento, así aseguro un buen producto”, afirma. Estefanía también se dedica a la ganadería, tiene vacas y aprovecha en pastar a otras cobrando un dinero por su servicio.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Estefanía invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus próximos sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Estefanía is 48 years old. She lives in the house she bought 20 years ago in the town of Chalampampa, along with three of her seven children. 

When she was a girl, she helped her parents with farming. She took care of the crops, watering and fertilizing, and many times she stayed for hours harvesting the fruit of the earth. This responsibility increased when her parents left her their farmland, where she had to do the planting herself, watch the quantity of seed, distribute the money and look for buyers; it was not easy. But now, with the experience that she has, she can sell her corn, potato, and barley crops at a good price, and she is also a very hard-working person. "I like to take care of the growing, in this way I assure a good product," she says. Estefanía also raises livestock. She has cows, and she takes advantage of letting others graze, charging money for the service.

She belongs to the "María Auxiliadora" ("Our Lady of Help") communal bank, and this is her fourth loan with MFP. In all these years she has learned to work and fight for her goals. In her association, she learned to be responsible and make her loan repayments, which they bring to each monthly meeting. 

Estefanía will use the money in this loan to purchase natural fertilizers to spread on her next planting of corn.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers for her corn crops

loans.name: Mili

texts.es:
Mili tiene 30 años. Vive en la casa que compró hace 9 años, junto a su esposo Luis y sus tres hijos.  
Su esposo trabaja en la construcción de una hidroeléctrica, es por eso que después de varios días y hasta meses, regresa a casa. Mili comenzó a vender golosinas, en una carreta, en la puerta de la escuela de su localidad. Los dulces, bebidas y demás productos para los niños, hacen que obtenga buenos ingresos, pues es la única que vende en la escuela, por ello espera aprovechar todo este año, ahorrando lo necesario para obtener un capital sólido. Asimismo, durante las tardes, se dedica a la venta de tamales y jugos en un puesto que alquila a la gobernación en una casa céntrica de la ciudad. Ahí ya tiene muchos años vendiendo, por ello espera ahorrar lo necesario para poder remodelar el local y obtener más clientela. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Mili invertirá este dinero en la compra de más dulces, galletas, chocolates y bebidas, para su puesto.
texts.en:
Mili is 30 years old and lives in a house that she bought 9 years ago.  She lives with her husband, Luis, and their three children.

MIli's husband is working on the construction of a hydroelectric plant.  He returns home after a number of days or even months.  Mili started selling candies from a cart by the entrance to an elementary school in her town.  She sells sweet treats, drinks and other products to the children and this earns her a good income as she is the only person to sell at the school.  She hopes to make the most of this whole year, saving the money she needs to have a solid amount of capital.  During the afternoons, Mili also works selling tamales and juice from a stall that she rents from the government in a central location in the city.  She has been selling there for many years and hopes to save up the money she needs to remodel her premises and attract more customers. 

Mili belongs to the 'María Auxiliadora' community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  Over the years, she has learned to work hard and fight to achieve her aims.  In her community bank she has learned to be responsible and make her repayments on time at each monthly meeting.

Mili will invest this money in buying more sweet treats, cookies, chocolates and drinks for her stall.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats, cookies, chocolates and drinks for her stall

loans.name: Siv

texts.en:
Siv is a resident living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 47 and married with four children, two of whom are still under her care while the other two are married already and have independent livings. Siv farms rice and beans on her own plots of farmland to produce yields for her family. Every year, Siv also does farmwork in the Preah Vihear province to increase her income because she owns around three hectares of farmland there.

As of now, Siv would like to borrow additional income through HKL to purchase two cows for farming purposes. Through this loan, Siv believes that she will be able to work out her plan and improve her business. In the future, she aims to increase her land holdings in order to increase output and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for farming purposes.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives with her husband (a driver) and 2 children at Yabiw near Takoradi. Beatrice sells eggs, which she has done for 9 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their housing and utility bills. Beatrice will use her loan to purchase crates of eggs to sell. With the new profit, she will continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 26. She is married and has been selling charcoal for almost one year, thanks to her previous loan which has helped her to make her new charcoal business progress. She has requested the loan to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luvinda

texts.es:
La señora Luvinda, es una comerciante  que vende productos varios en su pulpería  ubicada en el barrio la libertad desde hace 11 años, ha tenido 45 créditos con Ceprodel, inicio desde el año 2005.es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en donde labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las ocho y media  de la tarde, con los créditos  le ha permitido incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, también los financiamientos con la institución.
 Le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y mantener el sustento a su hogar. Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de  productos como: granos básicos, uso para el aseo personal, abarroterías, bisuterías etc. Se siente agradecida con Ceprodel, por la confianza que le han brindado, con los préstamos ya que gracias a estos préstamos a ella  le ha permitido  mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luvinda is a businesswoman who for 11 years has been selling various products in her general store in the La Libertad neighborhood.  She has had 45 loans with Ceprodel, and she started in 2005.  She is an enterprising and hard-working person.  She works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 8:30 at night.  The funding from the institution and the loans have allowed her to increase the variety of products she offers her customers.

It has allowed her to improve her home and support her household.  She is requesting the loan to buy products like basic grains, products for personal hygiene, groceries, and miscellaneous goods.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the trust they have given her with the loans.  Thanks to the loans she has been able to improve her living conditions and those her family.

loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, products for personal hygiene, groceries, and miscellaneous goods.

loans.name: Saint-Joseph Group

texts.fr: SAINT-JOSEPH est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Germaine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de André. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Germaine a peu fréquenté l’école. Germaine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Germaine vend depuis près quatre ans, des tissus et des glacières par le système de distribution. Germaine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C’est la première fois que, Germaine et les autres membres du groupe SAINT-JOSEPH sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SAINT-JOSEPH is a group of three persons whose members are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Germaine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 36 years old and married to a driver by the name of André. The couple have one child, in school and in their care. Germaine attended school very little. She lives together with her child and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

To help cover the diverse household expenses, Germaine has been selling cloth and insulated containers through the distribution system for four year. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. 

This is the first time that Germaine and the other members of the group SAINT-JOSEPH have requested financial support from ALIDé for bolstering their working capital and their business, as well as for responding further to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy cloth and insulated containers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther operates a grocery shop at Yabiw near Takoradi, which she has done for 6 years. She sells items such as milk, Milo (drink mix), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, powdered milk, and others. She is married with children. Esther uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Esther plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary extracts palm and kennel oil, which she sells at Yabiw near Takoradi. Mary  is married. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their housing bills. Mary will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel to extract her oil. With the new profit, she wishes to buy a machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kennel.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas, tiene 40 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año y tiene un puesto en el mercado donde vende ropa para damas. En este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú pudo mejorar su negocio generando más ganancias, también le gusta mucho asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que las capacitaciones que allí recibe de parte de su promotora le enseñan mucho a ahorrar, invertir en su negocio, así como también aprende a educar bien a su hijo y le trasmite todo lo que aprende. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como casacas, chompas, pantalones, polos.
texts.en: Marcelina is a member of Azucenas (White Lilies) Communal Bank. She is 40 years old, she is a single mother and she has one child. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 1 year, and she runs a stall in the market selling women’s clothes. In the year she has been a member of FINCA Peru she has succeeded in improving her activity earning more money; she has also enjoyed taking part to the meetings of her Communal Bank, because the seminars she has attended there have taught her a lot about saving and investing in her activity as well as about learning how to properly educate her child, to whom she teaches everything she learns. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her stall such as jackets, jumpers, trousers and polo shirts.

loans.use: To buy jackets, jumpers, trousers and polo shirts.

loans.name: Super Unit Group

texts.en: Jariatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Jariatu was born in Lunsar town about 38 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has four children, three of whom attend primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Jariatu sells jewelry and has been in this business for five years now. With the help of this loan, Jariatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, increase their sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Jariatu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy a large quantity of jewelry to add to her current stock. Also included on the photo (second from right) is the loan officer, Edward.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of jewelry to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est, présidente du groupe d’affaire « Mutiifu»,  âgée de 33 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de 4 enfants.  La cliente est sociétaire d’un  mini  restaurant de l’auberge, situé tout proche du marché central Virunga. Environs 3 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 14 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  les aliments et recettes destinés à la cuisine de restaurant(1 sac de haricots, 50 kg de pommes de terre, 20 litres d’huile de table, les épices, fromages, etc.). En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  Les bénéfices de son entreprise lui permettent de vivre aisément. Les défis majeurs sont les taxes et l’insécurité dans la province.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client, Kabuo, is the president of the group "Mutiifu". She is 33 years old, a woman living alone, and the mother of four children. This client is an associate of a mini-restaurant in an inn located very near the Virunga central market. She has been in this business for about three years. 

Kabuo just completed fourteen loan cycles with the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan must serve to supply her with food and recipes for the restaurant's kitchen (a sack of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liters of table oil, spices, cheeses, etc.) 

In addition, her ambition is to expand her enterprise, educate her children, and build a house. The profits from her enterprise will enable her to live with ease. The major challenges are taxes and insecurity in the province. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions favoring poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy a sack of beans, 50 kg of potatoes, 20 liters of table oil, some spices, cheeses, etc.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 50-year-old married woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is a fish vendor in her community. She buys fish from fishermen and sells them at her stall. She hopes to acquire other products that she could sell. 
Prudencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in a more lucrative business. Prudencia is requesting a loan worth 8000 PHP, which will be used to buy more fish to sell. Prudencia believes that if she is provided with financial support through this loan, she will be able to augment her sales and eventually her income from the business. With the capital that will be provided to her, she will have the resources to buy more stock to cater more customers.
She plans to use the additional income generated from her fish-vending business to reinvest in her current business. Moreover, she wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Leh We Hold Fine Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Leh We Hold Fine" group from Kono, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are amall-scale businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Sia, 30, who appears on the right. She was born in Tankoro, is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic, and all of her children are attending school. Sia has been selling biscuits, butter, sweets, soaps, and other small household items and foods for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items to sell. 

Note: the loan officer also appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy small foodstuffs and household items for resale.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 52 años. Vive, desde hace 25 años, en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Pampas, junto a sus dos hijos.
Enviudó hace algunos años y recibe la pensión por el trabajo de su esposo. Pero para poder mantener la economía de su hogar y ser independiente, comenzó, desde hace 6 años, a vender ropa. La clave es traer ropa de ocasión, por temporada (invierno, verano y otoño). Por ello, constantemente viaja a la ciudad de Lima (capital), para comprar costales de ropa importada, pues existen meses en los que ya tiene el pedido. Considera su negocio muy rentable, pues en su localidad hay pocas tiendas que ofrecen prendas de calidad y sobre todo a la moda, es así que no tiene competencia. Ella espera, más adelante, poder abrir su propia tienda donde pueda mostrar la ropa, ya que en la actualidad tiene que ofrecerla de casa en casa. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su crédito número 11 con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Hilda invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de ropa surtida, para niños, varones y mujeres, sobre todo comprará casacas por el frío, ya tiene pedidos.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 52, has lived in a rented house in Pampas for 25 years.  She lives with her two children.  She was widowed several years ago, and she receives the pension from her husband’s work.  However, in order to be able to support her household and be independent, she started selling clothes six years ago.

The key is to get clothing for special occasions and seasonal clothing (winter, summer, and fall).  To do this she constantly travels to the city of Lima (capital) to buy sacks of imported clothes.  There are months in which she already has them on order.  She considers her business to be very profitable.  In her area there are few stores that offer quality clothes, and most importantly, clothes that are in style.  That is why she does not have competition.

In the future she hopes to be able to open her own store where she can display the clothing.  She currently has to sell door to door.

She belongs to the María Auxiliadora communal bank, and this is her 11th loan with MFP.  In all of these years she learned how to work and struggle for her objectives.  In her communal bank she learned to be responsible and to make her monthly payments at every meeting.

Hilda will use the money from this loan to buy stock like clothes for children, men, and women.  Mostly she will buy jackets for the cold because she has orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes, especially jackets for the cold weather.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita tiene 28 años. Desde hace 2 años vive en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Pampas, junto a su hija Alexandra.  
Sus comienzos no fueron fáciles, trabajó mucho para ahorrar el dinero necesario para abrir su propio negocio. Siempre tuvo en mente una juguería, pues en la ciudad no hay una, cuando la abrió, hace 6 años, no tenía competencia, vendía muy bien. Y en todo ese tiempo pudo ahorrar y comprar más cosas para su negocio, como sillas, vasos y una licuadora y demás adornos para su local. “De esa manera se mirará más elegante y confortable”, pensó. Ahora cuenta con varias juguerías a su alrededor que le hacen competencia, pero como ella es antigua en el negocio tiene su clientela ganada, por ello no se desanima, al contrario desea seguir mejorando en la atención. Ahora ya cuenta con señoritas que le ayudan en la atención. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Sarita invertirá este dinero en la compra de fruta (plátanos, papaya) por cajones y si el dinero le alcanza remodelará su juguería con nuevas sillas.
texts.en:
Sarita is 28 years old.  For two years she has been living in a rental house in the town of Pampas together with her daughter Alexandra.

At first, things were not easy.  Sarita worked hard to save the money she needed to open her own business.  She always had a juice bar in mind because there wasn't one in her town.  When she opened the bar six years ago there was no competition and her juices sold very well.  Over the years she was able to save up and buy more things for her business such as chairs, cups, a blender and decorations for her premises so that it would look smarter and more comfortable.  She now has several juice bars round about her which provide her with competition.  However, as she has been in the business the longest, she has already gained her customers.  For this reason, she does not become discouraged.  She would like to continue improving her service.  She now has some young ladies who help her to serve her customers.

Sarita belongs to the “María Auxiliadora” community bank and this is her eighty loan from MFP.  Over the years, she has learned how to work and fight to achieve her goals.  Within her community bank, she has learned to be responsible and to make her repayments on time at each monthly meeting.

Sarita will invest this money in buying fruit (bananas and papaya) by the crate and, if she has enough money left over, she will refurbish her juice bar with new chairs.

loans.use: to buy fruit by the crate for her juice bar

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamamd is a 28-year-old married man from Gaza.
For the last two years, he has owned a grocery store located in the main street where there is a good movement and customers.
He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner and a fridge and install some shelves in order to increase the amount of good he can offer.
With these changes, Mohammad will be able to increase his income and meet the needs of customers and thus improve the quality of his life and his job.
His ambition is to own a huge mall in the future.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a fridge and install some shelves

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is 33 years old, she is married and lives in a small village of Terjola District with her family: her husband, George, two children (six and 11 years old) and her parents-in-law, who are pensioners. Her children study in the village school. George works in construction and earns a service fee for his work. Irine is busy with her agricultural business. She has two milking cows and produces cheese. Some of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. Irine and George work hard, but their income is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses for the six members of the family. Irine requested a loan to start-up new business. She plans to purchase household goods and clothing in Tbilisi (the capital of Georgia) and sell them in her village and in nearby villages. As a result, the monthly income of the family would increase and they would be able to expand their businesses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase household goods and clothing.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This is Hasan, 47, a resident of Lebanon. He is married to Awatef, a very kind woman. They live together in one of the old villages of Lebanon. They live a very modest life, especially after suffering from a bad financial situation. Hasan is the main source of income for the family and seeks to offer his family a fair way of living.  He has operated a fishery since 2004, and he is satisfied with the results he has attained so far. 

Today, Hasan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy a car equipped with the needed supplies to be able to maintain the fish in good and fresh condition. He notes that this will allow him to serve a wider range of people and increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own seafood restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a car equipped with the needed supplies to keep his fish fresh.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married lady who has been selling grocery items in her grocery store located beside her residential house. She tells us that her business, which is about two years old, is doing well, but she says that she faces a challenge of seasonality since she experiences scarcity of some fruits and vegetables during the dry season. Asha is approaching her 50th birthday and is mother to five adorable children, none of whom is in school. 

Asha is requesting her first loan from Yehu to buy more merchandise so that she can better serve her customers' needs. She says that she was previously selling dumplings. Her husband is a farmer. Other sources of income include contributions from her sons who are working.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew, which she sells at Yabiw near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 2 years now. Janet is married and has 1 child. She uses her income to support her husband's efforts to feed their child. Janet will use her loan to purchase fish and bags of rice for her business. With the new profit, Janet plans to build a better stall.

loans.use: to purchase fish and bags of rice.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia operates a grocery shop, which she has done for 2 years now. She sells items such as milk, Milo (powdered drink mix), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk, among others. Sophia lives with her husband and 3 children at    Yabiw near Takoradi. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Sophia plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries.

loans.name: Filipenses 4.13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipenses 4:3 lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ena del Socorro de 39 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y nueva desde hace 2 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería. 

Ena asegura que gracias a los créditos y su iniciativa logro pasar de ser ama de casa a propietaria de su negocio de ropa y su meta es lograr tener una tienda.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rafaela quien se dedica al comercio de calzado y Martin José  quien es contratista.
texts.en:
The 'Filipenses 4:3' (Philippians 4:3) community bank consists of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people.  One of these people is 39-year-old Ena del Socorro who has been selling used and new clothing for two years.  She will invest this loan in her business and buy merchandise.

Ena says that, thanks to loans and her own initiative, she was able to go from being a housewife to the owner of a clothing business.  Her goal is to have a store.

The other members of the group are Rafaela, who sells shoes, and Martin José, who is a contractor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shirts, pants and dresses)

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, age 24, is a Kiva client who resides in the city of Mombasa. She is a merchant by trade and has managed a kiosk for three years. Saumu is the mother of two children who are still underage. She resides in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Saumu will use this loan to add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, and other fast-selling products. She does not have what she needs to satisfy her customers, so she wants to provide them with new products that she will sell in her kiosk. 

Today she wants to invest more into her business and display her products so that she can generate more income for her family. Her future plans include continuing her work with the support of Kiva so that she can fulfill her dreams and move forward with her family.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, and other fast-selling products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two piglets and build a pigsty.

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en:
Sopiko is 31 years old. She lives in a small village in Tskaltubo district with her two brothers. One of her brothers works in a petrol station and earns a salary. Sopiko and her second brother run an agricultural business. They have a bull and a plot of land, where they grow various vegetables, fruits, and maize. They sell their harvested products on the local open market. The family members work hard, but they still don’t have enough income to save for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of their house.

Sopiko requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is very old and damaged; the furniture is old and uncomfortable, too. With this loan, Sopiko will be able to change the furniture and repair the house. The family's living conditions will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after hard-working days in a more comfortable environment. They hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: One Word Sweet Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva located in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the members of the “One Word Sweet” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Kadie - pictured in the middle of this photo - is the leader of this group of women. Kadie is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in primary school. Kadie sells small foodstuffs and has done so for seven years now. With the help of this loan, Kadie will invest in her business by buying different kinds of foostuffs - for example, salt and pepper -  to add to her business. 

The loan officer is also pictured to the right of Kadie.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale in the food market

loans.name: Rouwayda

texts.en:
Rouwayda is a 35-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and has only one small child. They both live with Zaher, her husband and the father of her child. She, together with her husband, manages the family's costs. Her husband works at a local company. As for Rouwayda, she graduated as an engineer and started her free-lance job a few years ago. She works with AutoCAD, an engineering software, upon customers' request. She is very talented at her job and has many years of experience working in the same occupation.

With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l, Rouwayda will purchase new engineering tools for her business. She is very ambitious and optimistic about opening her own engineering office as soon as she can, in the hopes of enhancing her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new engineering tools for her business.

loans.name: Basama Ii Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Nimikoro, in Eastern Sierra Leone, about 28 years ago. She is married to a security guard, and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, beans, etc. and has been in this business for three years now.

With the help of this loan, Fatmata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, beans, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business. 

Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, beans, etc. in larger quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a 36-year-old married woman with three children ages 13, 6, and 5. Rosalie has been in the business of hog-raising for 14 years now. She is applying for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to raise and to buy more materials for hat weaving such as sticks, nylon, and coconut leaves. With financial support, Evelyn is optimistic about realizing her dream of expanding her business and reinvesting in it to increase her income. Moreover, she wants to earn more so that she will be able to pay the school fees of her children thus giving them more opportunity for better learning, which is necessary for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise and to purchase more materials for hat weaving such as sticks, nylon, and coconut leaves

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 47 años. Hace 10 años vive en casa de su madre, ubicada en la localidad de Chalampampa, junto a sus hijos. 
Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de la construcción, en sus inicios era un simple peón que ayudaba a los albañiles a construir, ahora ya es uno de ellos y tiene muchos contratos, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, pues en la zona no existen muchos albañiles, sobre todo con experiencia. Actualmente está trabajando en la construcción de una piscina temperada en la zona, la gobernación de la localidad lo contrató por su habilidad. Por esa razón tiene que llevar sus propias herramientas para su trabajo, ya que solo le pagarán la obra al culminarla. “Ya invertí mucho dinero en eso”, afirma. Leoncio también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra, papa y maíz. 

Él pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Leoncio invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de tablas por cantidad y algunas herramientas para realizar las construcciones.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 47 years old and has been living in his mother's house, in the town of Chalampampa, with his children for ten years.

Leoncio learned the building trade when he was very young.  At first he worked as a simple laborer, helping builders.  Now he is a builder himself and has many contracts which make him good profits as there aren't many builders in his area, especially experienced ones.  Leoncio is currently building a heated pool in his area.  The local government hired him because of his skill.  He has to use his own tools for the work because they will only pay him once the work is completed.  "I already invested a lot of money in it", he says.  In addition to this, Leoncio also farms.  He grows potatoes and corn.

Leoncio is a member of the 'María Auxiliadora' community bank and this is his eighth loan from MFP.  Over the years, he has learned to work and fight to achieve his goals.  Within his community bank he has learned how to be responsible and make his repayments on time at each monthly meeting.

Leoncio will invest his loan money in buying planks of wood in bulk.  He will also buy some tools for his building work.

loans.use: to buy planks of wood and tools for his building work

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is 23 years old from Gaza. He works as a painter and installer of gypsum boards and decorations in houses and shops. He has done this for 8 years and has two employees who help him.
Osama asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy more gypsum boards and molds to be able to develop his products and increase the number of decorations he can offer.
What makes Osama's business different is the variety of molds and shapes he does with the gypsum.

His ambition is to increase his income and get married, have his own family, and enlarge his business and increase productivity.

loans.use: to buy more gypsum boards and molds.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 50-year-old married woman living in Tagbilaran City, Bohol, Philippines. 
Evelyn has been a dressmaker for almost 30 years now. This business provides her the earnings to support the daily needs of the family. 
Evelyn is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy additional items for sewing like cloth, thread, and needles, among others. This will allow her to cater more to clients in her community since she can buy the materials needed with the loan.
In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business and try to venture out into other lucrative business to augment her income. With this, she will be able to reach out to larger number of clients in her locality. With the income from the business, Evelyn will be able to help her husband in meeting the needs of the family. Any additional income will be saved for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional items for sewing like cloth, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán, tiene la edad  de 50 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el hijo mayor le ayuda en las labores de realizar muebles. El con el crédito pretende comprar  herramientas y algunos utensilios para arreglar la madera como barnices, pinturas lijas. El tiene pensado tener más herramientas y más madera para trabajar de una forma más ágil y eficaz junto con su hijo y poder hacer más trabajos a mas personas   y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Hernán, 50, lives with his wife and two children.  His oldest son helps him to manufacture furniture.  He intends to use the loan to buy tools and materials to make furniture like varnish, paint and sandpaper.  He’s thinking about having more tools and more wood to be able to work more efficiently and quickly alongside his son in order to be able to do work for more people thus generating more profits and attaining a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He’s had no previous loans from state banks and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mawazo est vice présidente du le groupement d’affaire Uamsho,elle est divorcée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. La cliente est vendeuse de Jus local Madrakwa. En plus, elle vend également des denrées alimentaires (tomates,arachides, pomme de terre,  haricots, etc.). Elle commença ses micros activités avec le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Actuellement, elle vient de réaliser 22 cycles de crédit dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 bassins de tomates,1 bassin d’arachides, 50 kg de sorgho,le reste d’argent servira dans la scolarité de ses enfants. La cliente ambitionne améliorer son entreprise. Le défi majeur pour elle, c’est l’insécurité persistante dans les zones d’approvisionnement. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.Il sied de signaler une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Mawazo, is the vice-president of the business group Uamsho. She is divorced and the mother of five children. This client is a retailer of the local drink "madrakwa". She also sells groceries (tomatoes, peanuts, potatoes, beans, etc.) She started her micro-business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. Currently, she just completed 22 loan cycles in the Hekima microloan program. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with 2 tubs of tomatoes, a tub of peanuts, and 50 kg of sorghum. The rest of the money is for educating her children.

Her ambition is to improve her enterprise. The major challenge for her is the persistent insecurity in supply zones. She therefore thanks Hekima for its support helping small-scale women entrepreneurs to be autonomous. It should be mentioned that one client is carry her baby.

loans.use: to buy 2 tubs of tomatoes, a tub of peanuts, and 50 kg of sorghum

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is a very beautiful woman with good character. She has been a successful business lady for 4 years. She sells dried fruits in the local market. In the local market she has her own spot and many customers. She has many friends but they can’t help her in business because they are needy and haven’t attained skills in business. Her husband went to Russia and works there. She lives alone with 2 little children. She wants to develop her business and use the profit to hold a celebration of her sons. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing her business. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy goods for developing her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali runs a bodaboda (motorcycle taxi), a business he has run for almost four years. He would like to service his motorbike, which is why he has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, Ali plans to purchase spare parts and do general servicing of his motorbike. This will allow him to have an advantage in the market. 

Ali lives with his two children only, since he and his wife divorced. Being the main breadwinner in the family, he sees it as important that he is able to expand and develop his business so he can earn more income and support his family. His dream is to see that his two children are educated.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and do general servicing of his motorbike.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 21-year-old Lebanese woman. She is single, living with her parents and three siblings. She, together with her youngest sibling, contribute to the family’s household expenses, by operating her business. Not to forget their main income provider, their father, who works nonstop to provide his family with a suitable life.  Hanadi wishes to bring additional income to her family, which is why she started her own home business as a private teacher. Her students visit her from all the neighboring villages. She is well known for her professionalism. 

Today, Hanadi is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new books and a new board. In that way, she will be able to better develop her work and deliver the information in a good way. This is how Hanadi works every day to enhance her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new books and a new board for teaching.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a resident of Tiribe on the south coast of Kenya. She has been selling fish at a busy market for the last two years. She is married and has six children: four boys and two girls.

Mejumaa has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Kiva partner Yehu to buy more fish and also to pay the school fees for her children. She is optimistic she will have enough income to educate her children.

Mejumaa says that seasonality and price fluctuations in the local markets remain the major challenges she faces. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

loans.use: to buy more fish and also to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: One Word Women Asso. Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “One Word Women” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Finda, pictured in the middle of this photo, is the leader of this group. Finda is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom attend primary school. Finda sells small foodstuffs in the local food market, and has done so for four years now. With the help of this loan, Finda will invest in her business by buying rice, sugar, flour, oil, etc. to sell in the food market and expand her business. 

Note: the loan officer also appears in this photo

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, oil, etc. to sell in the food market.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 65 años. Desde hace 7 años vive en una casa alquilada, en la ciudad de Pampas, junto a su esposo Félix y una de sus cinco hijos; Flor. 
Tiene 9 años de experiencia en venta de comestibles, bebidas (al por mayor) y ropa. Su habilidad y el apoyo de sus hijos, le ayudaron a implementar estos negocios en la plaza de su ciudad, donde tiene mucha concurrencia de personas y en épocas de festividad, de turistas. Le va muy bien, ya que dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo en la atención de sus negocios. La venta de bebidas es su principal ingreso, cuenta que vende 20 cajas por semana y en fechas festivas, vende mucho más, “ya pierdo la cuenta”, comenta con alegría. En pocos años se convirtió en una de las principales distribuidoras de bebidas para todas las tiendas de los alrededores. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “María Auxiliadora” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. En todos estos años aprendió a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos, y en su asociación aprendió a ser responsable y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas que mensualmente aportan en cada reunión.
Graciela invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bebidas, por cajas, para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Graciela, 65, has lived in a rented house for 7 years in the city of Pampas with her husband, Félix, and one of her five children, Flor.

She has nine years’ experience selling groceries, beverages (at wholesale) and clothes.  Her skills and help from her children helped her start these businesses in the city square where there are many passers-by and during the festival seasons, many tourists.  She does very well because she spends most of her time tending to her businesses.  

Her main income producer is the beverage sales.  She relates that she sells 20 cases per week and during feast days sells even more.  “I’ve already lost count,” she comments cheerfully.  In just a few years she became one of the main beverage suppliers for all nearby stores.

She belongs to the “María Auxiliadora” communal bank and this is her fifth MFP loan.  In all this time she learned how to work and strive for her objectives.  In her association she learned how to be responsible and to make the installment payments they contribute each month.  Graciela will use the money from this loan to buy beverages by the case to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four school-aged children. She has owned a beauty salon since 2000 where she welcomes customers to provide them with beauty services such as hairdressing, make-up, laser, etc… She has one part-timer assisting her in achieving the work. 

Safaa's husband works as a taxi driver in order to supplement the revenues and better support the family. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of new beauty products and supplies. She intends to enhance her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services in order to satisfy their demand and keep them loyal to her shop. In the future, she plans to expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new beauty products and supplies

loans.name: Mèvodé Yves Magloire's Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON 14 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies appartenant à une même association d’artisans. Le représentant du groupe, Mèvodé Yves Magloire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 41 ans et est mariée à une couturière du nom de Bernadette. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Mètohoué Vincent vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Mètohoué Vincent a peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la broderie. Depuis quatorze ans Mètohoué Vincent exerce cette activité dans son atelier et à son domicile. Afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Mètohoué Vincent désire équiper son atelier par l’acquisition d’une machine. C’est la deuxième fois que  Mètohoué Vincent et les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON 14 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
DJROMAHUTON 14 is a group of three persons whose members belong to the same artisans association. The group's representative, 
Mèvodé Yves Magloire (with his hand raised in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a clothier by the name of Bernadette. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Mètohoué Vincent lives together with his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Mètohoué Vincent attended school very little but learned how to embroider. For fourteen years, he has been in this business in his workshop and at his home. To satisfy his customers further, he would like to equip his shop by acquiring a machine.

This is the second time that Mètohoué Vincent and the other members of the group DJROMAHUTON 14 have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and their business, as well as responding to customer requirements. The loan received previously has indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy a machine

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.en:
Flaviano is a 54-year-old married man living in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines, who has been a fisherman for several years now. He is also running a guso or seaweed farming business. Eucheuma, a red alga, endemic to Philippine marine waters, is the twentieth-century wonder plant. It is so called because of its many important uses in various industries. From this seaweed is extracted carrageenan, a valuable substance used in products that need gelling, suspending, thickening, emulsifying and water-holding. 
Flaviano is requesting a loan worth 25000 PHP which will be used to buy fishing equipment such as fish nets, ropes, and fuel for the fishing boat. 
Flaviano works hard to earn a living in order to support the needs of his family.
In the future, Flaviano hopes to expand his business and to reinvest in it to augment his income. He believes that it takes perseverance, hard work, and support in order to succeed in business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as fish nets, ropes, and fuel for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Samuel Angel

texts.es: Sr. Samuel tiene 32 años y es soltero, el se dedica al servicio de amplificación animando distintos acontecimientos sociales como bautizos matrimonios fiestas de quince años y distintas actividades sociales este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Samuel  utilizara  este préstamo para compra de poder para amplificación y dos parlantes para seguir equipando su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejora de tecnología en su actividad, el Sr. Samuel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el rubro, pero sigue adelante  ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a sus padres, el va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando la tecnología en cuanto a amplificadores, su deseo para su negocio es tener una orquesta propia ya que también quiere incursionar en la música pero eso en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en: Samuel is 32 years old and single.  His business is providing sound services, livening up different social events such as christenings, weddings, 15th birthday celebrations etc.  This loan is his first with the institution.  Samuel will use his loan to buy an amplifier and two speakers so that he can continue equipping his business.  He is requesting this loan to improve his technology.  Samuel faces challenges in his business such as the high level of competition in his field.  However, he continues making progress as this is the only business with which he supports his parents.  He will use the profits he makes to continue improving his amplifier technology.  His wish for his business is to start his own band because he would also like to break into the music business in the not-too-distant future.

loans.use: to buy and amplifier and two speakers

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. María tiene 53 años y es casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 18 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de variedad de productos de primera necesidad y variedad de dulces, golosinas y queques en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución y va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería por mayor como dulces y queques para surtir su tienda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital, la Sra. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de capital de trabajo y con los beneficios del crédito seguirá con la compra de mercadería para seguir surtiendo con variedad de productos su tienda.
texts.en: María, 53, is married and has an 18-year-old son.  She sells a variety of basic staple items plus candy, snacks and cakes in her neighborhood store located at home.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and she is going to use it to buy merchandise like candy and cakes at wholesale to stock her store.  The reason for requesting this loan is to increase capital.  María faces business challenges like lack of working capital and will use the benefits of the loan to continue buying merchandise in order to stock the store with a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Vicenta Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta tiene 46 años y tiene dos hijos de las edades de 14 y 16 años,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan empanadas y variedad de repostería, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Alto Miraflores,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Vicenta  va a usar este préstamo para pagar la prótesis dental de sus hijos, la Sra. Vicenta enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de una panadería Alemana que produce en mayor cantidad  ya que  la capacidad de su panadería es pequeña, la Sra. Vicenta es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Vicenta is 46 years old and has two children who are 14 and 16 years old.  Her business is making and selling bread, empanadas and a range of confectionery items.  Her bakery is located in Alto Miraflores district.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Vicenta will use her loan to pay for her children's dental prostheses.  Vicenta faces challenges in her business such as competition from a German bakery which bakes in larger quantities as her bakery is small.  She is a person who has a desire to do well in life.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to pay for her children's dental prostheses

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Women In Action” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a security guard and they have two children. Mariama has been a businesswoman for eight years now; she sells rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edward.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is 38 years old. He lives in Lebanon with his family that is composed from his wife Itaf and their small child. Nader is obliged to work continually as he is responsible for covering his family expenses. He works from his house, where he sells musical instruments. He has been involved in this occupation since 2002. 

As he becames an expert in these instruments, he will be able to respond rapidly to his clients' demands. In order to better support his family, Nader works in parallel at a local company. He suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s the reason why he’s asking today for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing new musical instruments. He confirms that the loan will help him raise his income by 25%. One of his greatest dreams is to satisfy all the needs of his child.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new musical instruments

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is an industrious woman who owns and manages a kiosk selling different consumer goods to support her family. She has been in this business for almost four years. Behind her house, Dzine plants and takes care of a few kinds of vegetable crops and sells the farm produce from her home. She is now 33 years old and a mother to four children, who currently live with her since they are all in primary school.

To improve her business, Dzine decided to take out a loan from Yehu and Kiva to purchase bales of flour and sugar. Also, with the balance of funds, she intends to buy a plot of land to construct a house. Through the loan use, Dzine has a strong commitment to work out her plan and upgrade her living standard. She hopes to experience a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Madeleine's Group

texts.fr:
Madeleine en position debout sur la photo et à l’extrême droite a adhéré au bv de femmes catholiques depuis juin 2008.Elle est âgée de 60 ans;est mariée et mére de 05 filles te un garçon qui ont entre 36 ans et 20 ans.

Son activité consiste à faire du commerce de céréales.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d’activité pour l'avoir exercée pendant de longues années.

Avec le financement reçu elle compte s'approvisionner en mil et maïs.Elle va acheter 500kg de mil et 500kg  de maïs.

L'objectif visé à travers ce prêt est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants qui étudient,accroitre son épargne et participer à la prise ne charge de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Madeleine, who is standing at the far right in the photo, joined the banc villageois for Catholic women in June 2008. She is 60 years old and the mother of five girls and a boy, who are from 20 to 36 years old.
 
Her business involves commerce in grains. She has good experience in this type of work for having done it for many years.  

With the financing received, she intends to stock up on millet and corn. She is going to buy 500 kg of millet and 500 kg of corn. 
 
The targeted goal of this loan is to ensure the education of her children in school, grow her savings, and help to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet and corn

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who are attending school. He has been working as a salesman in a local company since 2000. He is the main source of income for his family. His wife owns an international phone call shop in her town, but her revenue is not sufficient to support the family well financially. 

Today, Hussein is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children's educational fees. His only target is to ensure a good educational level for his children through graduation and to avoid facing financial problems in the family’s management. In the future, he is planning to work in one more job in order to earn additional income and meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's educational fees.

loans.name: Solangi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solangi lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Feliz de 54 años quien se dedica al comercio de frutas desde hace 20 años aproximadamente. Negocio que con su ardua labor y los créditos a ampliado su capacidad de producción.
 El crédito lo invertirá en la comprar cosechas de mango y mamón y su meta es diversificar su producto para poder laborar todo el año.
Los otros integrantes son Liseth del Socorro de 45 años quien vende ropa y Cinthya de 22 años quien vende legumbres.
texts.en:
The “Solangi” group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is María Felix, 54, who has been a fruit seller for about 20 years, a business whose productivity she’s expanded thanks to her hard work and loans.

She will use the loan to buy crops of mangoes and Spanish limes; her goal is to diversify her product so that she can work year-round.

The other group members are Liseth del Socorro, 45, who sells clothes and Cinthya, 22, who sells legumes.

loans.use: to buy Spanish lime and mango crops.

loans.name: Luz Del Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Esfuerzo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María Catalina de 57 años se dedica a la venta de detergentes desde hace 4 años. Ella inicio vendiendo legumbres luego con las ganancias empezó a vender comida y actualmente vende productos de limpieza.
El crédito lo invertirá en jabón de baño, cajas de detergentes y cloro…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Vilma quien vende nacatamales y tortilla y Martha quien vende productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
The “Luz del Esfuerzo” (Light of Effort) group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is María Catalina, 57, who has sold detergent for the last four years.  She started out selling legumes and then used profits to start selling food and currently sells cleaning supplies.  She will use the loan to buy bath soap, boxes of detergent, chlorine bleach, etc.

The other group members are Vilma who sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and tortillas and Martha who sells cleaning supplies.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Samoura's Group

texts.fr:
Ce bv  a été créé en décembre 2011 et à pour responsable sadiakhou  qui est à gauche en position assise sur la photo.

Elle est âgée de 60 ans,son activité principale est le commerce de beignets,de sandwichs et de bananes.Elle fait ce commerce depuis longtemps ce qui lui a permit d'avoir un groupe de clients qui n’achète que chez elle.

Avec la somme reçue,elle compte acheter du pain ,de la banane,des haricots et de la farine en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle.

Ses objectifs sont de prendre en charge:la scolarité des enfants;accroitre son épargne et participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on December 2011, and its official is Sadiakhou, who is sitting at the left in the photo. She is 60 years old. Her main business involves commerce in beignets, sandwiches, and bananas. She has been in this business for a long time, and this has gotten her a group of customers who buy from her only. 

With the amount received, she intends to buy some bread, bananas, beans, and flour in quantities sufficient enough to meet the demands of her customers.

Her goals are to cover the cost of her children's education, to increase her savings, and to help with day-to-day expense.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans and flour

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old man. He is single and lives with his parents and two siblings. He shares the family living costs with his father and youngest sibling. Mohamad opened his own supermarket at an early age and he has two years of experience in managing it. 

After realizing the supermarket’s missing products, Mohamad decided today to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of goods and groceries, which will help him increase his income through the big variety and thus improve his sales by 15%. Mohamad is facing serious competition with other supermarkets, but he is controlling his sales by offering extraordinary prices with good quality, which gives him an advantage over all his competitors.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of goods and groceries

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with six grown-up children. She is 55 years old and has had this food business for more than 30 years now. 

Marcelina sells items like biscuits, bread, candies and the like to the people in her community. This food vending business provides her the income that she needs in order to support the family. Marcelina joined CEVI hoping that she could gain access to financial services offered by the organization. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like biscuits, bread, candies and other snack foods. In the future, Marcelina hopes to continue investing in her food vending business. Any additional income will be saved for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like biscuits, bread, candies and other snack foods

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 35, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead. She’s married to Ali who is a motorcycle operator. They have four children who she loves very much.

She decided to purchase a "bodaboda" (motorcycle) together with her husband, who operates it. She started the business one year ago and to date the business is doing very well, though her husband says that he faces some challenges of insecurity as he rides in dark alleys at times. Fatuma does farming even as her husband goes out to operate the motorcycle business. Both contribute to the welfare of the family. Fatuma likes her business because it allows her to earn additional income to help her spouse cover household expenses and meet the needs of her children who are the motivating force to continue making progress.

She feels grateful for the financial support to stay in business. She will use the requested KES 20,000 to purchase spare parts and service the motorcycle, and any remainder to invest in the farm.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and service the motorcycle

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 40 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. They have three children together and all the children attend school. He owns a hardware store, and has been selling construction materials for 10 years. With the loan, he wants to add more construction materials to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is aged 40.  She is married with four children. She has been selling beans and maize for the past 20 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a 63-year-old woman. She lives in a small village in the Terjola District with her husband, Levan. They run a dairy farm with three milk cows. Ludmila milks the cows twice a day and sells the milk on the local open market. They also have a vineyard and produce wine, which is sold in nearby villages. Along with the agricultural business, Ludmila is busy with trading. She has a grocery store in her village. 

Ludmila requested a loan for purchasing stock for her store. She will offer the customers a big assortment of products. Thus, the income of the family will increase. With the increased profit she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Flores lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de granos básicos actividad que inicio hace cuatro años. El crédito lo invertirá en maíz, frijoles, arroz…etc. y su meta es tener un centro de abastecimiento bien surtido.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sadia quien vende enchiladas y Silvana quien vende pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
The “Las Flores” (The Flowers) group has three hardworking, enterprising members.  One of them is Rosa del Carmen who sells basic staples, an activity she started four years ago.  She will use the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, etc.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked supply center.

The other group members are Sadia who sells enchiladas and Silvana who sells “pinol” and “pinolillo” [corn meal and cocoa mixtures].

loans.use: to buy basic staple items.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y con 1 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en una Comunidad cercana a unos  10 minutos del centro de Tambogrande en la margen izquierda del río Piura. El se dedica a la crianza de ovinos (8 cabezas), porcino (5 cabezas) y aves de corral. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace 5 años. También se desempeña como peón agrícola en parcelas aledañas. Entre estas dos actividades Jose trata de mantener el bienestar de su familia y darle a su hijo educacion y salud. Pensando en el futuro y los prospectos de su negocio, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la adquisición de más ganado y compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos de la adecuada alimentación de animales. En la zona hay gran cantidad de pasto para la crianza de ganado ovino, ya que es temporada de lluvias y esto ayuda en la crianza de mas ganado.
texts.en:
José, 30, lives with his partner and has one child in his care.  He lives in his own house, located in the Tambogrande district about 10 minutes from the center of Tambogrande on the left bank of the Piura River.  He works raising sheep (eight head), pigs (five head), and poultry.  He has done this work for five years.  He also works as a farmworker on neighboring plots of land.
