With a goal to grow her business further Gulzina has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy four heads of sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase four heads of sheep.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Im is 37 years old and married. She has four children: two daughters and two sons, who are still in school and dependent on her. To make a living and take care of her children, she is a grocery seller while her husband plants rubber seedlings for sale. She has been in the business for several years. The main challenge is unhealthy rubber seedlings.

Im has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has completely repaid the loans. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business and also to send her children to school. With a good business, she is applying for a loan to buy more grocery items for her store, as well as to buy plastic bags for rubber seedling plantings. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her business and make more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags for rubber seedling planting.

loans.name: Lunai

texts.en:
Lunai is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Lunai has requested a loan to help her develop and improve her plantation. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Lunai hopes to earn a good income to be able to help her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her plantation such as chemicals, fertilizers, bushknives, taro roots, wheelbarrows, and forks.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 30 years. She also earns income from e-loading and raising livestock.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her manicure business.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, ages 22, 20, 18, 13 and six.
Emelita has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. She is asking for a loan worth 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy feed for the hogs and  repair the pigpen. 
In the future, Emelita would like to expand her hog-raising business by buying more piglets to raise. Emelita works hard to earn more because she wants to continue sending her children to school for a better education. Also, she wants to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs and repair the pigpen.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Arlene has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Arlene has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for five years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupas usadas e produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (fardos de roupa, farinha, óleo, peixe, arroz, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar a sua mercadoria.  

No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo um congelador para conservar os produtos e conquistar mais clientes, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a saturação do mercado e o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en:
She's a widow and has three children, all of them adults. She lives with her family in a house she owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with her.
She runs her own business selling used clothing and essential goods. With the current loan she intends to purchase products (bundles of clothing, flour, olive oil, fish, rice, etc.) in order to stock up and diversify her merchandise.
In the future she wishes to expand her business by purchasing a freezer to store the goods and get more customers. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
Her challenge is market saturation and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase products for selling (bundles of clothing, flour, olive oil, fish, rice, etc.).

loans.name: Farhodjon

texts.ru: Фарходчон житель города Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Фарходчон покупает автомашины и сдает в аренду. Сейчас у него имеются две автомашины марки STAREX, которые отданы в аренду. Он берет кредит для приобретения еще одной автомашины этой же марки, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Farhodjon is a resident of Dushanbe. He is 28 years old and married. His wife is a homemaker. Farhodjon buys cars and rents them out. At this time he has two cars by make of Starex which have been rented out. He is taking out the loan to buy one more vehicle by the same make to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car by make of STAREX.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines.

Corazon is borrowing PHP 1,650 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency. Corazon is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support six children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season. Rebecca is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Geanny

texts.es:
Geanny tiene 23 años, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y es muy trabajadora. Su pareja desde hace 7 años con Milton, junto a él tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años. Toda su familia vive en la casa propia que le dejó su padre como herencia, desde ahí lucha constantemente junto a su cónyuge para llegar al éxito y brindarle a sus hijas un mejor futuro.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, huevos, azúcar, aceite y algunas verduras, que a diario se necesitan para la alimentación en el hogar. Tiene una pequeña bodega que pudo construir hace 4 años en su casa y ahí trabaja sola o en ocasiones lo deja al cuidado de su pareja. Renueva toda su mercadería de manera semanal, ya que la venta en su sector es muy fluida y eso le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar algunos gastos educativos y alimenticios de sus hijos. 
Se siente muy tranquila, pero no se conforma con lo que ha logrado, es por eso que desea incrementar su capital para poder incluir nuevos productos envasados y aumentar el stock de todo lo que ofrece a la venta, comprando gaseosas, embutidos, helados y algunos artículos de pasamanería, con el objetivo de multiplicar sus ingresos para empezar a juntar el dinero que necesita para mejorar su vivienda, pensando en la seguridad y comodidad de sus pequeños hijos.

Este es el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que los integrantes de su grupo la puedan ayudar a integrarse rápido para continuar trabajando junto a ellos de ahora en adelante, ya que considera que siempre es importante aumentar el capital de trabajo para hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 300) comprará algunos embutidos, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, huevos, pan, leche y otros artículos que necesita para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Geanny, age 23, is a woman with a great desire to get ahead, and she is very hard-working.   She and her life partner of seven years, Milton, have two children, ages five and three.  The whole family lives in their own house, which her father left her as an inheritance.   This is where she and her husband are always struggling to be successful and to give their daughters a better future.

Her work consists of selling basic needs products like rice, eggs, sugar, cooking oil, and some vegetables.   These are products that are needed every day to feed the household.  She has a small grocery store, which she was able to build in her house four years ago.  She works there alone, or she occasionally leaves it under her husband’s care.

She restocks her merchandise weekly.  Sales in her sector are very fluid, and this generates good income that allows her to pay some of her children’s expenses for education and food.   She feels very at ease, but she  will not stop with what she has achieved.  That is why she wishes to increase her capital in order to be able to include new packaged products.  She wants to increase her stock of everything that she sells.  She will buy soft drinks, sausages, ice cream, and some handicraft items.  Her objective for doing this is to increase her income in order to start getting together the money that is needed to improve her home.  She is thinking about her young children’s safety and comfort.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She hopes that the members of her group are able to help her assimilate rapidly in order to continue working together with them from now on.  She feels that it is always important to increase working capital in order to make her business grow.

She will use the requested 300 soles to buy some sausages, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, bread, milk, and other items that she needs to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy some sausages, soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, bread, milk, and other items that she needs to stock her store.

loans.name: Efren  Flor  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Efrén Flor se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen Elizabeth, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 12, 10 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los 2 siguientes en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es una ama de casa muy luchadora y trabadora que para ganar algo por su cuenta y contribuir para los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, al igual que su esposo que también vende este tipo de mercadería pero de forma independiente, ya que él se desplaza a los campos y lugares alejados mientras que ella vende por el sector donde vive y otras partes de la ciudad, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Trabaja unos cuatro días por semana,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  ropa de todo tipo y genero. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su marido vaya a vender su mercadería.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Efrén Flor Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional festivities of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people.

This is a group of people who decided to come together some time ago and form this communal bank that has served them a lot since with the loans they have been able to improve the small businesses that they have.  The make a living from diverse activities such as shops, services and food sales among other activities.
 
In this place we meet Carmen Elizabeth, 35 years old, married and from this relationship she has four children who are 17, 12, 10 and 3 years old.  The oldest child studies in college and the next two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a struggling, hardworking housewife that, in order to earn something on her own and contribute to the household expenses, makes a living in business.  She sells clothes of all kinds, the same as her husband who also sells this type of merchandise but independently, since he travels to the country and distant places while she sells in the area where she lives and other parts of the city.  Her form of sales is door to door.  She works four days per week, leaving her products with her clients on credit and then collecting the debt every week.  For five years she has made a living with this business and it is going very well for them.

She is going to employ this loan to buy clothes of all types and materials.  She has been in the Communal Bank from the beginning and she likes the speed with which the loans go out.
 
Her dream is to buy a car so that her husband can go sell his merchandise.

The two small photos are of two partners that couldn’t be present when the photo was taken of the group.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Pilar has been in this business for 11 years. She also earns income farming rice.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida works hard to support four children. She is married and has a duck-raising business in the Philippines.

Zaida has requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Zaida is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Renia

texts.en:
Renia is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Renia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Renia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income farming rice.

Renia aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jolanie

texts.en:
Jolanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business. Jolanie has been in this business for 11 years.

Jolanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ines Virginia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por la diversidad de sus productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal La Dolorosa Del Pechiche.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de  17, 15, 11 y 8 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Nuestra amiga trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta, ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo para que este pueda sacar adelante el negocio él tiene, es una pequeña fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en la construcción de viviendas), él junto con el papá de nuestra amiga se encargan del trabajo de elaborar y vender los ladrillos, nos cuenta que ellos entregan sus productos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su fabrica para luego llevarlos a distintos lugares donde venden estos productos, llevan más de 10 años dedicados a esta actividad la misma que les deja muy buenas satisfacciones.

Este crédito es para comprar leña, aserrín, agua y palmito que son los materiales que emplean para elaborar los ladrillos. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la seriedad con que se trabaja en la institución.
 
Sus sueños seguir adelante y que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for the diversity of its typical products like the famous straw hats that are well-known both inside and outside the country for example, the members of the “La Dolorosa Del Pechiche” communal bank meet every fifteen days. We met Inés, 34, here. She’s married and has four children who are 17, 15, 11 and 8 years of age.  The two oldest attend secondary school and the two youngest attend elementary school.  Her husband’s an artisan.

She works in a factory in the city of Manta and is taking out the loan to help her husband so that he can move his business ahead.  He has a small brick-making factory (material used in home construction).  He works together with his father-in-law manufacturing and selling the bricks.  She tells us that they deliver their goods to merchants who come by the factory to then take them to various places where they sell them.  They’ve been in business more than ten years and it produces very good profits.

This loan is to buy wood, sawdust, water and hearts of palm which are the materials used to manufacture bricks.  She’s been in the communal bank six years and likes it because of the formality the institution works with.  Her dreams are to continue moving forward and that her children have a very good education.

loans.use: to buy brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina lives in Corella, Bohol, a town in the Philippines, with her family. She is 66 years old, a widow, and has two grown children. She relies on hog raising, as well as charcoal buying and production, for an income. Her income has helped meet the needs of her family like food. However, Crispina is in need of additional capital to buy feed, piglets, and supplies for charcoal production. With a loan, Crispina will be able to successfully produce healthy hogs that she can sell for a profit and she can produce more charcoal.  

Crispina is optimistic that this will boost her business productivity and her profits. All of Crispina's income will be used for her family's daily consumption and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, and supplies for charcoal production

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Chhan is a 34-year-old married woman who is responsible for five single children. She and her husband raise her children in a peaceful village in Ornlong Veng district, Oddar Meanchey province, Cambodia. Chhan has been working in the farming business for almost 12 years, earning a suitable income to satisfy her living needs. She enjoys doing this business because it is the family's sole income, which enables her to send all of her children to school. Her husband and children also help in the business to ensure high production and to reduce some labor costs

As of now, Chhan would like to take out a loan of US $800 to purchase a farm mower and pesticide spray to grow her crops well. This will help her to improve her current business and make her more productive. In years to come, Chhan hopes to be a successful entrepreneur and own a large lot for farming purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a farm mower and pesticide spray to grow her crops well.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose est une jeune femme de 36 ans en couple, mère de 3 enfant dont l'âge varie entre 5 et et 10 ans, les trois vont à l'école, elle a aussi un de ses neveux à sa charge. elle a un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 9 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des pagnes et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Rose is a young woman, 36 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of three children, who are from 5 to 10 years old. The three go to school. She also has one of her nephews to support. Rose has a small sewing workshop which has been operating well for nine years already. She also does embroidering but lacks all the equipment for fulfilling her orders more quickly and meeting customer needs on time. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy pagnes (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and sundry sewing supplies (needles, pins, linings, thread…) which will allow her to avoid going to the market all the time. She will be able to sew and to sell to her customers. The profits derived from this loan will enable her not only to buy her sewing supplies for expanding her business but also to meet certain needs of hers, as well as those of her small family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and sundry sewing supplies

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 52-year-old married woman residing in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She runs a motorcycle business and has had this business for 20 years now. This is the source of her daily income. 

Vicenta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for the maintenance and repair of the motorcycle driven by her husband. Through this loan the motorcycle will be brought back to its normal working condition. 

In the future, Vicenta hopes to expand the business and plan to buy a new motorcycle to double their earnings. Any additional income will be saved for future use and reinvestment.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Aries  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Aries.
 
La señora María Gloria pertenece a este grupo el cual está formado de 12 mujeres y 3 hombres. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir,  durante el tiempo que llevan se sienten muy bien por la ayuda recibida, la señora María Gloria tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, con ella vive el menor de sus hijos. Su marido es empleado privado.

Nuestra amiga para poder ganar algo por su cuenta hace mas de 6 años empezó un pequeño negocio en su domicilio, ella vende  agua en bidón, nos cuenta que para esto ella requiere de la colaboración de dos personas a quienes les paga para que realicen las entregas,  cuenta actualmente con dos tricimotos en las cuales sus empleados entregan los botellones de agua,  tiene muchos clientes ya que dia a día tiene muchos pedidos, ella dice que al principio se le hizo difícil el negocio pero con el paso de los días aprendió y comenzaron a realizarle los pedidos, actualmente tiene muchas personas a quienes surte de este liquido vital.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua en bidón para la venta diaria y ciertos repuestos para las tricimotos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es comprar un pequeño camión.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Aries” communal bank meet every fifteen days in the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) neighborhood in the city of Portoviejo.

María Gloria is a member of this group which has 12 women and 3 men.  They are involved in diverse activities like general commerce and services, among other things.  They joined their efforts in order to access benefits offered by Fundación Espoir.  During the time they’ve been together they have felt very good because of the support received.  

María Gloria, 58, is married and has four children who are all adults now but the youngest of her children still lives with her.   Her husband is a private employee.

In order to earn something on her own she started a small, home-based business six years ago.  She sells large bottles of water and she says that to do so she has the help of two assistants she pays to do deliveries.  She has two three-wheeled delivery carts her employees use to make the water deliveries.  She has many customers that day to day place many orders.  She says that at first it was difficult but as days passed she learned and orders started to come in.  She currently has many people she supplies this vital liquid to.

She will use the loan to buy bottled water to sell daily and certain spare parts for the three-wheeled vehicles.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and likes it because of the help she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to buy a small truck.

The small photo is of a member who wasn’t able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy large bottles of water and vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed a loan of 11,000 PHP that she used buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Marilyn would like to apply for another loan of 16,000 PHP for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and support the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilyn dreams of expanding her business and giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Many years of experience in the farming business have made Chea more productive and helped her improve her farming practices. She believes that she will be successful one day through her hard work and commitment. Agriculture is the major source of her family’s income, with which she is able to provide for the basic necessities of all of her children. Chea is now 56 years and has eight children - five single children and three married children. She permanently lives together with her spouse and some of her children in Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.

With the requested amount, Chea would like to purchase a motorcycle for home use. This purchase will help her family in their transportation needs. Chea has been with HKL for three years and this will be her third loan to better her family's living condition. For the business plan, Chea plans to purchase extra lots of farm land to maintain high production. She is very grateful for the unending support from lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
This is Edisa. She previously accessed a loan of 16,000 PHP that she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 18,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Edisa hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase products for her store

loans.name: Leamar

texts.en:
Leamar works hard to support four children. She is married and has a rice retail business in the Philippines.

Leamar requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season. Leamar is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 53 years old and married with 3 children. With 1 child in school, Adelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Adelfa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned,goods, soap, sugar, etc. 

In the future Adelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Naipah

texts.en:
Naipah works hard to support her family. Naipah is married and has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines.

Naipah requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more accesories to sell to customers.

Naipah has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Naipah would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more accesories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen is 31 years old and married with 4 children.  With all her children in school, Aireen works very hard to provide for them.

Aireen runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

Aireen has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Aireen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie works hard to support her family. Benjie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Benjie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish making.

Benjie has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Benjie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Gimia

texts.es:
Gimia tiene 36 años, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora. Es madre de cuatro hijos, menores de edad, cuyas edades son 16, 14, 7 y 3 años. Vive junto a ellos en la casa que construyó su ex pareja, con su ayuda. Ama a cada uno de sus hijos y es por ellos que entrega lo mejor de sí, día a día, para cumplir su meta, de verlos profesionales.  

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, y complementa su negocio con la venta de carnes. Tiene un pequeño puesto que acondicionó en su vivienda, donde trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos en turnos rotativos. Para abastecer su negocio se dirige al puerto pesquero de la ciudad donde obtiene los ejemplares más frescos y de mayor demanda por sus vecinos, mientras que los abarrotes los compra en las tiendas comerciales del centro de la ciudad, realiza esta faena cada tres días o semanalmente. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 6 años, que es el tiempo que lleva criando sola a sus hijos. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene ingresos económicos sin hacer mucho esfuerzo, pues se siente un poco cansada cuando hace mucha actividad, además tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a sus hijos con sus tareas escolares. Le esta yendo bien, ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntual sus cuotas. Espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en un futuro en un taller de carpintería.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, le está yendo bien hasta ahora con su grupo, se siente cómoda trabajando con ellos y espera seguir siendo la socia puntual y muy responsable como hasta ahora. Además quiere agradecer por la oportunidad que le dan para poder invertir en una actividad comercial.

El monto solicitado (S/. 800) lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes; como un saco de arroz (S/.180), un saco de azúcar (S/.150), tres cajas de leche chica (S/. 126), dos cajas de leche grande (S/.160), pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina y otros productos. Asimismo, destinará un monto fijo aproximado de S/. 150  para la compra diaria de pescado.
texts.en:
Gimia, age 36, is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  She has four minor children, ages 16, 14, 7, and 3.  They live together in the house that her ex-life partner built with her help.  She loves each one of her children, and it is for them that she gives the best of herself day to day in order to reach her goal of seeing them become professionals.

Her work consists of selling groceries and basic needs products.  She complements her business with meat sales.  She has a small place that she arranged in her house.  She works there with the help of her children, who take rotating shifts.

In order to stock her business she heads to the city fishing port where she gets the freshest fish, which has the greatest demand from her neighbors.  She buys the groceries at commercial stores in the center of the city.  She does this task every three days or weekly.  She has been doing this work for six years, which is the amount of time that she has been raising her children alone.

What she likes about her work is that she has income without a lot of effort.  She gets a little tired when she does a lot of activity.  Also, she has time to be able to help her children with their school work.  It is going well for her.  She has good income that allows her to make her payments punctually.

She hopes to be able to expand her business and to start saving in order to invest in a carpentry shop in the future.

This is her first loan with MFP.  So far it is going well for her in her group, and she is comfortable working with them.  She plans on continuing to be a punctual and very responsible member like she has been so far.  Also, she is grateful for the opportunity given to her so that she is able to invest in her business activity. 

She will use the requested 800 soles to buy groceries like a sack of rice (180 soles),  a sack of sugar (150 soles),  three crates of small cartons of milk (126 soles), two crates of large cartons of milk (160 soles), bread, eggs, cooking oil, bananas, onions, flour, and other products.  A fixed amount of approximately 150 soles is for the daily purchase of fish.

loans.use: to buy groceries, bread, bananas, and fish for her store.

loans.name: Delphine Martine

texts.fr: Delphine est une femme de 27 ans,mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 01 et 04 ans,de plus elle a à sa charge un neveu.Un de ses enfants va déjà à l'école.Comme activité elle a une alimentation dans laquelle elle vend des produits alimentaires(pains, chocolats, bombons, gateaux,etc...)et églement des boissons hygiéniques depuis 01 an dans un quartier de la place.son activité est centré dans la vente en détail.Ses bénéfinices ne lui permettant pas de subvenir aux multiples besoins de sa famille,elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter son stock de boisson hygiénique et aussi acheter des sacs de riz afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et par conséquent accroitre ses bénéfices étant donné que son alimentation est très convoitée.Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir un dépôt dans l'avenir,agrandir sa boutique et à la longue acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
Delphine is a 27-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children, from 1 to 4 years old. She has a nephew to support as well. One of these children already goes to school. For work, Delphine has a grocery store where she has been selling food products (breads, chocolate, candies, cakes, etc.) and also hygienic drinks for a year in a local district. Her business is focused on retail sales. Her profits do not allow her to meet the many needs of her family. 

With this loan, she would like to increase her stock of beverages and also to buy sacks of rice for responding better to customer needs. Consequently she can increase her profits, given that her store is much coveted. 

Her ambition is to open a warehouse in the future, expand her store, and to buy a plot of land eventually.

loans.use: to buy hygienic beverages and sacks of rice

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раисе 65 лет, вдова, имеет дочь и воспитывает внука. Раиса в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от деятельности позволили Раисе купить дом для ее семьи.  Благодаря упорному труду Раисы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 корова с приплодом, продажа молока приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Раиса обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм.  Доходы от кредита Раиса планирует вложить в ремонт дома для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Raisa is 65 years old, she is a widow, has one daughter and is raising a grandson. Raisa has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation for 25 years as an additional source of income for her family, a business which she started with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS). The income from her business has allowed Raisa to buy a house for her family. Because of her hard work Raisa now has one cow with a calf and the sale of milk brings her around 8,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Raisa has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy calves for feeding. She plans to invest the income from the loan to remodel the house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase calves for feeding.

loans.name: Percy Felipe

texts.es:
Percy tiene 62 años, vive al lado de su esposa quien se dedica a la crianza de animales, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y su esposa es su gran apoyo y sobre todo su mayor compañía. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de ocoña, distrito que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y porque su actividad principal es la agricultura, se cultiva el arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión en especial programas periodísticos, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Percy solo tuvo estudios de educación primaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Percy trabaja con mucha dedicación en su parcela, ya que él es agricultor, él le dedica al cuidado de su cultivo alrededor de  10 horas al día; él cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo le gusta mucho el trabajo de campo.

Percy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono para su cultivo, de esta manera podrá mejorar su cultivo y sobre todo tener una buena cosecha, con lo cual sus ingresos mejorarían y su calidad de vida también mejorara, así Percy seguirá trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser el mejor agricultor y tener una buena cosecha”.
texts.en:
Percy, 62, lives with his wife who works raising animals.  His children are all adults now and his wife’s his great support and above all his greatest companion.  His dwelling is located in Ocoña District, a district noted for its hot climate and because its main activity is agriculture.  Rice, broad beans and corn among others are grown there; its residents are very kind.  

When he has free time available he likes to watch television especially news programs.  He also enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz Chaufa.”  Percy only attended elementary school but would have liked to go to university very much

Percy works very diligently in his parcel every day since he’s a farmer.  He spends about 10 hours daily tending to his crops.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very responsible and above all because he likes working in the fields.

Percy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they give him he will be able to buy manure for his crops and to improve the crops that way to above all have a good harvest that will improve his income leading to improved quality of life too.  Percy will continue to work every day to make his greatest dream a reality: “To be the best farmer and have a good harvest.”

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Mayra Rosabel

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su calidez climática, también por poseer playas hermosas y sobre todo lugares turísticos maravillosos como las “Islas Ballestas” y “El Candelabro de paracas”. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio y también en ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pato con papa a la huancaína”. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar confecciones textiles.

Mayra trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, pero también trabaja como ayudante de ventas de pintura en una pequeña ferretería, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismática.

Mayra está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercaderia para su negocio como perfumes, cremas, labiales, sombras, entre otros, asi de esta manera ella podra tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y sobre todo podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder estudiar una carrera universitaria y Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Mayra, 22, is a young woman living in the city of Pisco, a city noted for its hot climate and for having beautiful beaches and above all wonderful tourist attractions like the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabrum.  When she has any free time available she likes to play volleyball with her girlfriends and neighbors.  She also on occasion takes advantage of the opportunity to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Arroz con Pato con Papa a la Huancaína.”  She only attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied textile design.

Mayra works very hard in her small business selling beauty products but also works as a sales assistant selling paint in a small hardware store.  She works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 20 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her work because she’s very kind to customers and above all because she’s very charismatic.

Mayra is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they give her she’ll be able to buy merchandise for her business like perfume, cream, lipstick, eye shadow, etc. in order to have more variety available to offer her customers and above all continuing to strive daily to make her greatest dream a reality: “To be able to study a university career and finish building her house out of substantial building materials.”

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y sobre todo acogedor, conocida como la Tierra del Sol Eterno ya que siempre se ve el sol a pesar del invierno, en Ica desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva esparrago, paprika, pallares, garbanzos, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo sobre le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Sopa Seca”. Con el apoyo de sus padres logro estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería agroindustrial.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo muchas ganas de salir adelante Edwin trabaja como albañil, electricista, pintor, entre otros; él es muy ingenioso y siempre le gusta aprender cosas nuevas cada día ya que el nos comenta siempre hay que aprender de todo en esta vida, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el mes ya que los trabajos que el realiza son un poco complicados y requieren de mucha paciencia y sobre todo es muy minucioso, también tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado alfalfa ya que también vende este tipo de plantas para la alimentación de algunos animales como conejos, cuyes, entre otros; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable con los clientes y sobre todo le gusta hacerlo de buena manera y por ello siempre lo recomiendan.

Edwin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono para poder mejorar el crecimiento de su cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha, de esta manera el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, así seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda de material noble”.
texts.en:
Edwin, 39, lives in the city of Ica noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  It’s known as the “Land of the Eternal Sun” because the sun’s always out even in winter.  Agriculture is commonplace in Ica especially cotton, grapes, asparagus, paprika, lima beans and garbanzo beans, among others.  When he has any free time available he enjoys eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious ‘Sopa Seca.’  With help from his parents he managed to study the career of Agroindustrial Engineering.

With much effort and above all drive to get ahead, Edwin works in construction as a bricklayer, electrician and painter, among others.  He’s very ingenious and always likes learning new things every day; he says that one must learn a bit of everything in life.  He works around 8 hours daily and can take care of up to 10 customers monthly since all of the jobs he does are somewhat complicated and require much patience and attention to detail.  

He also has a small parcel of land that he’s planted alfalfa in since he also sells this type of plant as animal feed for rabbits and guinea pigs among others.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very responsible towards his customers and above all because he likes doing things right so he’s always being recommended.

Edwin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy manure to improve the growth of his crop in order to obtain a good harvest thus improving his income and quality of life.  He will continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: “To continue building his house with substantial building materials.”

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy carismática, en su grupo la reconocen como buena pagadora y muy puntual. Ella es madre de dos hijos de 14 y 6 años, viven en su casa propia a lado de su pareja, Wagner, con quien lleva ya 5 años de feliz relación. Todos los días se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo mejor.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y otros productos de consumo diario. Trabaja desde que tenía 8 años de edad, ayudando a su madre que también se dedicaba a este negocio; sin embargo, al quedarse sola a los 14 años, tuvo la necesidad de continuar trabajando para solventar sus gastos, desde entonces ha generado sus propios ingresos y ahora lo hace por la familia que ha formado. Su pequeña tienda es abastecida directamente por los proveedores que llegan hasta su casa llevando todos los productos que previamente ella ya ha solicitado, a excepción del pescado, éste lo obtiene comprando, al por mayor, en el puerto de la ciudad. El paso de los años le ha enseñado que el esfuerzo debe ir de la mano con el progreso y ella lo sabe muy bien, ya que antes vendía por la calles de la ciudad, ahora lo hace en el puesto que obtuvo en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en otro espacio que complementario que tiene en su vivienda. A pesar de lo que ha conseguido, aún sus sueños son muchos y es por eso que espera que su negocio siga en crecimiento.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer muchas actividades de su hogar, le está yendo muy bien, aunque asegura que en meses como estos la demanda comercial disminuye un poco, pero eso no la desmotiva y sigue adelante.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que le vaya bien y que los miembros de su grupo le den la oportunidad de poder integrarse al ritmo de trabajo de ellos. Espera que no sea el primer y último préstamo recibido, sino que pueda seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo juntos ya que considera muy bueno que le den la oportunidad de poder tener mayor cantidad de capital de inversión.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.600) comprará abarrotes; como un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, una docena de botellas de aceite, una docena de leche evaporada chica, cuyo monto total asciende a S/.400 soles. Asimismo, destinará un porcentaje aproximado de S/.100 diarios para la compra de pescado.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and a good, kind, charismatic woman. In her group she's known for making payments and being on time. She is the mother of two children, ages 14 and 6, and they live in their own home with her partner, Wagner. They've already had five happy years together. Every day María pushes herself to get her family ahead in life and to give them the best. 

Her work consists of selling basic needs items and other goods for daily consumption. She has worked since she was eight years old, helping her mother who also worked at this business. However, since being on her own since age 14, she's had to keep working out of necessity to pay the bills. Since then she has generated her own income, and now she does it for the family she's created. 

María's small store is stocked directly by suppliers that come to her house with all their goods, which she puts in an order for. The one exception is fish, which she buys wholesale at the port in the city. The passing of years has taught her that the efforts of her hands leads to progress, and she knows it very well. Before she used to sell in the streets of the city; now she has a store in the main market of the city, and another, complementary space in her home. Through all that she has gained, she still has many dreams, and that's why she hopes that her business will keep growing. 

The thing that she likes about her job is that she has time to do a lot of things from her home, and it's going well for her. Even though she says that in months like these commercial demand drops a little, it doesn't discourage her and she continues on. 

This is María's first loan with Micofinanzas Prisma. She hopes that it goes well, and that the members of her group give her the opportunity to join in to the rhythm of their work. She hopes that it won't be the first and last loan, but rather than she can keep working together for a long time. Already she thinks it's great that they're giving her a chance to be able to have a larger amount of capital for investment. 

With the amount requested (600 PEN), she will buy groceries such as a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a dozen bottles of oil, and a dozen of small cans of evaporated milk, which totals close to 400 PEN. At the same time, she will designate a portion - approximately 100 PEN daily - for the purchase of fish.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, bottles of oil, milk, and other goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 41 años. Está casado, hace 3 años, con Judith, con quien lleva una relación de muchos años y fruto de su amor tienen dos hijos de 16 y 11 años. Juntos viven en la casa que consiguieron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en un asentamiento humano y ahí comparten juntos el mismo deseo por mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la pesca y venta de pescado por kilos o unidades. Empieza con la preparación de todas las herramientas que usa para pescar, luego se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse al río donde ya tiene conocimiento que existe mayor abundancia de peces y ahí empieza su faena con mucha paciencia y cautela. La destreza que tiene en este oficio le permite recolectar en poco tiempo la cantidad precisa de peces que le generarán las ganancias que requiere, ya que mientras va pescando va seleccionando también las mejores especies y los tamaños que prefieren sus clientes. Por lo general, su rutina de pesca puede realizarla durante 3 días y cuando tiene la cantidad precisa de pescado en su bote regresa a la ciudad para ofrecerlos a la venta en el puerto pesquero o en algún mercado cercano. 
Lleva en este negocio cerca de 4 años y le va muy bien, sin embargo desea generar otra fuente de ingreso para su familia estableciendo una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y golosinas en su casa y poco a poco ir implementándola hasta conseguir instalar un lugar agradable, surtido y completo, donde acuda la mayor cantidad de clientela posible y sus ingresos económicos se vean favorecidos.

Este es el primer préstamo con la institución MFP y está seguro que le irá muy bien, se compromete a ser un socio puntual y responsable con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Y está muy agradecido con la oportunidad y la confianza que le dan para poder realizar nuevos retos.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.600) comprará algunos abarrotes como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceites en botellas de litro, leche, fideos y golosinas (galletas, chicles y caramelos)  para dar inicio a su negocio de venta de abarrotes. Con otra parte del dinero, invertirá en renovar algunos anzuelos y herramientas de pesca, cuyo costo total promedia S/. 200.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 41 year old man. Three years ago he married Judith, with whom he had a relationship for many years. From their relationship they have two sons, aged 16 and 11. They live together in the house they were able to get in a settlement after a lot of hard work and dedication. They share the same wish to get ahead and improve their quality of life. 

His work consists of fishing and selling fish by kilos or units. He starts by preparing all of the tools that he uses to fish. Later he gets up very early to go to the river where he knows where the fish are. There he starts his work with patience and caution. The ability he has with this craft allows him to collect precise quantities of fish that will generate income that he needs. While he fishes he selects the best species and sizes that his customers prefer. In general, his fishing routine can be done over three days and when he has the precise quantity of fish he returns in his boat to the city to sell in the fishing port or in a mnearby market. 
 
He has been in this business for more than 4 years and it is going very well. Nonetheless he wants to generate another source of income for his family by opening a small grocery and candy store in his house. He has been setting it up little by little and has been able to install a pleasant, well stocked and complete locale where more people can go and where his income will be favorable. 

This is his first loan with MFP and he is sure that it will go very well for him. He is committed to being punctual and responsible with each of the payments. He is very grateful for the opportunity and trust that has been given to him to reach new challenges.  

With the ammount he has asked for (S/.600), he will buy some grocery itesm such as sacks of rice,  sacks of sugar, liter bottles of oil, milk, pasta, and candies (cookies,, gum and hard candies) .  All of this will be to start his business selling groceries. With another part of the money, he will renew some lures and fishing tools, whose total cost will be an average of S/. 200.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to stock his new store and some lures and tools for fishing.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 35 años, es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora. Tiene una pareja hace 18 años con quien tiene cinco hijos de 19, 18, 12, 8 y 5 años, los cuales son su motivo de trabajo y esfuerzo continuo. Vive en su casa propia, al lado de sus hijos y su pareja, que la apoya en todo lo que hace y juntos luchan por salir adelante.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de abarrotes. Tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo a cumplir esta función y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Recibe el apoyo de su cónyuge y de sus hijos y eso le permite contar con el tiempo suficiente para realizar algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal, comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 12 años. Y lo que le gusta es que produce sus ingresos económicos sin que esto le demande un excesivo esfuerzo, además tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a sus hijos más pequeños con sus tareas escolares. Le está yendo bien, ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntual sus cuotas. Espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en un futuro en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación en un buen colegio y universidad.

Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera poder cumplir con las exigencias de la institución y de su grupo y así poder ser una buena socia que pague a tiempo. Hasta el momento el grupo le dio una linda bienvenida y le dan la confianza para poder integrarse y convertirse en una socia buena.	

El monto solicitado (S/.500) lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como un saco de arroz (S/.180), un saco de azúcar (S/.150), tres cajas de leche chica (S/.126), pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina y otros productos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 35 years old and a hardworking young woman.  She has been married for 18 years to her husband, with whom she has five children ages 19, 18, 12, 8 and 5.  They are the reason for all her effort and work.

She lives in her own house with her children and her husband, who supports her with everything she does.  Together they fight to get ahead.

Kelly sells groceries.  She has her small grocery business in her house.  She dedicates all of her time to this and she is very content with her sales.  She gets support from her husband and her children, which allows her sufficient time to complete basic chores around her house.

She restocks her business weekly, buying from the wholesale shopping centers in the middle of the city.  She has been running this business for 12 years.  What she really likes about the business is that she can do this without excessive effort, allowing her time to help her small children with their homework.  It is going well, since she has good income which allows her to pay her loans on time.  She would like to increase her business and start saving to invest in home improvements and offer her children a better education in a good college and university.

This will be her first loan from the institution MFP.  She hopes to complete the requirements of the institution and of her group and therefore become a good member who pays on time.  The group has given her a warm welcome and they give her the confidence to be able to integrate and become a good member.  The amount requested (S/.500) will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as a bag of rice (S/.180), a bag of sugar (S/.150), three boxes of small milk cartons (S/.126), bread, eggs, oil, plantains, onions, flour and other products.

loans.use: to buy groceries (sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil, etc.) to stock her store.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Neri es una mujer de 41 años, tiene muchas virtudes, entre ellas está su gran optimismo y su deseo constante por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su pareja es Absalón, de 45 años, con quien ya comparte 20 años de feliz convivencia, a pesar de algunas carencias materiales, su gran amor le ha regalado tres hijos de 18, 16, y 7 años, y junto a ellos, viven en la humilde casa que pudieron construir como resultado de su trabajo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) y de algunas golosinas. Ha acondicionado su puesto de ventas en una sección de su casa y ahí atiende todos los días, algunas veces con la ayuda de su cónyuge o en ocasiones también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Abastece su negocio, comprando de manera semanal o quincenal, todo lo que necesita para poner a la venta entre galletas, caramelos, chicles, chizitos y gaseosas de todos los sabores y tamaños. Su clientela se orienta principalmente al rubro de los niños, exceptuando obviamente a las bebidas alcohólicas cuya venta lo realiza solo a personas mayores de edad y bajo ciertas condiciones de consumo responsable. Lleva dos años en esta actividad y sus ganancias han sido muy favorables desde que empezó. Su trabajo le permite cubrir los gastos básicos de su hogar y se siente bien porque puede colaborar con su pareja en el sostenimiento de su familia. Mientras él aporta del mismo modo con las ganancias que le produce su trabajo como ayudante en la extracción de madera. Su deseo es ver que su negocio se desarrolle ampliamente para que en el futuro pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, está segura que le irá bien y espera que los miembros de su equipo le den las facilidades para poder integrarse completamente al ritmo de trabajo para solicitar nuevos préstamos más adelante, ya que considera muy bueno que le brinden la oportunidad de poder incrementar su capital de negocio.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.600) comprará mayor cantidad de cervezas, gaseosas y complementará su stock de golosinas. Semanalmente compra 15 cajas de cervezas, cada una cuesta S/.35 y cinco cajas de gaseosa, costando cada una S/.8. Con el saldo comprará golosinas como chicles y caramelos de menta y limón.
texts.en:
Neri is a 41 year old woman. She has many virtues, among them her great optimism and her constant wish to improve her family's quality of life. Her spouse is Absalón, 45, with whom she has lived with for 20 happy years. Despite the lack of some materials things, their great love has given them three children, aged 18, 16 and 7. They live in their humble home taht they were able to build with their hard work. 

She sells beverages (beer and sodas) and some snacks. She has set up her sales point in a sectio of her house and sghe works there every day, sometimes with her spouse' help or sometimes she also gets help from her children. She stocks her business buying everything she needs to sell  weekly or every two weeks: cookies, candies, gum, crackers and all flavors and sizes of soda. Her clientele is mainly children, except for, obviously, the alcoholic beverages she only sells to adults and under certain conditions for responsible consumption. She has been doing this activity for two years and her earnings have been favorable since she started. Her work allows her to cover the basic household expenses and she feels good because she can help her spouse with the family support, as he contributes with the earnings from his job as an assistant in wood extraction. What she wants is to see her business develop well so that in the future she can offer a wider variety of products..

This is her first loan with the MFP and she is sure that it will go well for her and she hopes that the members of her team will give her the ability to integrate herself completly into her work rythym in order to ask for new loans in the future. She thinks that it is very good that she is being offered the opportunity to be able to grwo her business capital.

With the amount she has asked for (S/.600), she will buy a larger quantity of beer, sodas and will increase her stock of snacks.She will buy 15 cases of beer weekly at S/.35 each and five cases of soda, at S/.8 each. With the rest she will buy snacks such as gum and ment and lemon candies.

loans.use: to buy more beer, candies and sodas to stock her business.

loans.name: Nwxsha's Group

texts.en:
Nwxsha is a 32 year old, married Iraqi woman, and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nwxsha is one of the many Iraqi woman working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has five years' experience with this business, and to improve it she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in the past year to replace her old sewing machine and buy a chair and table for her work area. Having successfully repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, an embroidery machine and some nice quality fabric to be able to offer her customers a variety of new designs and services. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, an embroidery machine and some nice quality fabric.

loans.name: Marlit

texts.es:
Marlit tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy empeñosa y con deseos de superación. Está casada, hace 12 años, con Wilson, con él tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años, llamados Mónica y Marcos. Vive junto a su familia y a su suegro en la casa propia que obtuvo como un regalo de bodas por parte de sus padres. Su principal motivo para salir adelante es brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su trabajo consiste en poner a la venta los principales productos de primera necesidad y consumo diario; vende arroz, azúcar, huevos, panes, plátano, tomate, cebolla y otros. Tiene su negocio en un espacio que acondicionó en vivienda y trabaja todos los días brindado una atención cálida y amable. Lleva en esta actividad un año y gracias a ello puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos y de su familia en general. 
Se siente muy contenta porque colabora con el aporte económico en su hogar y cada día sus ingresos mejoran, aunque algunas veces pensó en desistir porque no se acostumbraba al horario de atención durante todo el día y muchas veces se sentía agotada. A pesar de ello, continúa y espera que su negocio siga creciendo con el paso del tiempo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy tranquila por el gran apoyo que le están brindando ya que siente que de esa forma su progreso económico y familiar continuará en ascenso. Agradece por la solidaridad que ha recibido en su grupo y por toda la orientación que le ha otorgado su asesor, eso la motiva a seguir esforzándose para cumplir con el pago puntual de todas sus cuotas.

El monto solicitado (S/. 800) lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes; como un saco de arroz (S/.180), un saco de azúcar (S/.150), tres cajas de leche chica (S/.126), dos cajas de leche grande (S/.160), pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina y otros productos hasta completar lo solicitado.
texts.en:
Marlit is 36 years old.  She is a very earnest woman with a desire to overcome her circumstances.  She has been married to Wilson for 12 years, and they have two children, ages 12 and 7, named Mónica and Marcos.  She lives with her family and her father-in-law in her own home which she received as a wedding present from her parents.  

Her main motivation for getting ahead is to offer a better future for her children.  She makes a living selling groceries.  Her job is to sell key products that are basic necessities and which people consume daily.  She sells rice, sugar, eggs, breads, plantains, tomatoes, onions and others.  She has her business in an area of her house that was built for this and she works every day offering warm and friendly service.  She has been at this activity for a year and thanks to this she has been able to cover the basic necessities of her children and of her family in general.  She feels very content because she contributes to the economic input of her household and each day her income improves, although sometimes she felt like giving up because she was not accustomed to the hours required every day and sometimes she felt exhausted. 

In spite of that, she continues and she hopes that her business will continue growing with the passing of time.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is very comfortable with the great support that they have offered her since she feels that in this way her economic progress and her family with continue to advance.  She is grateful for the solidarity that she has received from her group and for the orientation her advisor has awarded her.  This motivates her to continue to  work hard to complete her payments on time.  The amount requested (S/.800) will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as rice (S/.180), a bag of sugar (S/.150), three boxes of small milk cartons (S/.126), two boxes of large milk cartons (S/.160), bread, eggs, oils, plantains, onions, flour and other products to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy products for her store (bags of rice and sugar, milk, oils, breads, etc.)

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ethel works hard to support her family.

She makes and sells ice candy in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ethel is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her ice candy.

Ethel has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a 46 year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Florenda runs a motorcycle business with her husband and has had this business for 20 years now. This business provides them their daily income. 

Florenda is asking for a loan of 10,000PHP which will be used for the maintenance and repair of the motorcycle. If she would be provided with financial support, Florenda is adamant that she could further improve their business. The loan would be a great help for her and for the development and growth of the business. 
Florenda  hopes  to make lucrative investments for additional income. Moreover, she wants to double her hard work in order to sustain the needs of her two children, especially for their education. She is looking forward for her children to be professionals someday.

loans.use: for the maintenance and repair of the motorcycle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Lolita works hard to support her family.  She has a computer rentals business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Lolita is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her computer rentals business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients she needs in her business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 54 years old, married and has five children. She is very hardworking in doing her daily tasks. Being a good mother, Sok always take cares of her children and provides food and education for those at home. Aside from this, Sok is also involved in farm work alongside her spouse in order to keep the family out of poverty and achieve financial stability. For 33 years, Sok has worked cultivating rice, beans and potatoes.

Sok is asking for this loan to rent a tractor to till her land and to pay laborers for costs incurred in transplanting rice. This loan will help improve her farm and make her more productive. She hopes to obtain a better harvest in the coming season. With an increase in income, Sok will continue to support her children’s education and save for the future expansion of her business. This is her first loan from HKL and Kiva. She will make a good repayment to lenders, so later she can take another loan to improve her family.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till her land and pay laborers to transplant rice.

loans.name: Fredie

texts.en:
Fredie is a 43 year old fisherman living in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines.   He has been a fisherman for six years now. He joined CEVI because he wanted to gain access to financial services offered by the organization. Presently, Fredie is asking for a loan of  5000 PHP to buy additional materials for fishing and seaweed farming such as nets, straw and other things. With these things, he will be able to augment his catch and harvest, thus increasing the profit from the business.
 
Fredie works hard to support his family and five children ages 18, 12, eight, six and four. In the future, Fredie hopes to improve his fishing business to increase his earnings. Moreover, Fredie wants to invest and save for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy addtional materials for fishing and seaweed farming such as nets, straw, etc.

loans.name: Huth

texts.en:
Huth is 39 years old, married, and has five grown-up children. Only her last-born child is living with her in a small house in Baray district, while the other four are already settled for marriage and lives independently around Kompong Tom province. Huth has been a fish and lotus fruit seller since 2000. Her husband is the main supplier in this business, and two of her children serve as her motivation in pursuing her fish retail business.

Huth wants to expand her business, but unfortunately she suffers from financial constraints. This is why she decided to obtain a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorcycle which will help her in the business.  Also, her children can use it for a ride through the community to buy and resell fish for more income. She would appreciate it if she could get the loan from lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle which will help her in her fish retail business.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store business. Ma. Cristina has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from selling electronic re-load.

Ma. Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Ma. Cristina from Philippines

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kenya. She is advancing in the business sector, where she capitalizes on five years of experience in selling consumer goods in her kiosk.

She is married and contributes to the household expenses. She sees to the payment of the water and electricity bills. She is an active member of Yehu, where she has already repaid a previous loan.

Monica is seeking another loan of 35,000 KES for the purchase of flour and cereals. She hopes to strengthen her working capital and increase her profits in order to better meet her personal needs. Thanks for your support.

loans.use: purchase flour and cereals for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 50 years old and lives in Corella, Bohol. She is married, with three children. Rufina is currently engaged in operating a sari sari store (a small general store) and raising chickens. She has been in this business for 20 years. She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise, like snack food, seasonings, rice, toiletries, and feed for her chickens. 

Her goal is to make the most of her livelihood so that she will not resort to borrowing for a long time. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and additional merchandise like snack food, seasonings, rice, and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Diosylina

texts.en:
